title: Ticket #7173: Starter stalls after reconnect when streaming IO
description:
A user reports via htcondor-admin that they have seen the Starter stalled for days after the job completes, with the Schedd still showing the job in running state.

The job in question is streaming stdout, and the Starter/Shadow connection experienced a brief disconnection and then reconnected 90 seconds later. (they have a wide area pool).

The last lines of stdout are repeated "a number of times" presumably because of the reconnect. The rust ticket has additional logs.

They first noticed it with the 8.8.3 release, but say it may have been happening with earlier releases also. 

from StarterLog.slotN
07/28/19 02:31:01 (pid:3808) Lost connection to shadow, waiting 7200 secs for reconnect
07/28/19 02:32:32 (pid:3808) Accepted request to reconnect from <:0>
07/28/19 02:32:32 (pid:3808) Ignoring old shadow <10.10.4.68:9618?addrs=10.10.4.68-9618&noUDP&sock=6072_9b36_61265>
07/28/19 02:32:32 (pid:3808) Communicating with shadow <10.10.4.68:9618?addrs=10.10.4.68-9618&noUDP&sock=6072_9b36_61265>
07/28/19 02:32:32 (pid:3808) Recovered connection to shadow after 91 seconds
07/28/19 02:32:32 (pid:3808) Streaming i/o handler reconnecting E:\Jobs\2017s6767\2019-07-25\JFlow9_js88_s506081567_j09a80873-aed3-11e9-9e89-7048860ddf79_out.txt to shadow
07/28/19 02:32:32 (pid:3808) Retrying streaming write to E:\Jobs\2017s6767\2019-07-25\JFlow9_js88_s506081567_j09a80873-aed3-11e9-9e89-7048860ddf79_out.txt of 65 bytes at 3150 after reconnect

The last line above is the last line of the log, 2 days later the slot was still stalled.

The pool is a Windows pool, although that may more may not be relevant to the problem.
